Tannin Characteristics: Barely noticeable, clean finish typical of metodo classico sparkling wines.
Body Characteristics: Elegant, clean, and balanced with a hint of ripe fruit and fresh acidity.
Finish: Pleasant, slightly fruity with a hint of bread crust.
Aroma: Fresh and lasting with ripe golden apples, wild flowers, and subtle yeast.
Flavor: Crisp and elegant with ripe fruit, floral notes, and a touch of bread crust.
Vinification: Metodo classico, second fermentation in bottle with selected yeasts.
Maturation: Aged on lees, time not specified.
Recommended Consumption: Drink young or within 3-5 years for freshness
Vineyard: Various communes in Val d’Adige, Val di Cembra, and Valle dei Laghi
Summary: Ferrari F1® Brut TrentoDOC 1902 is a <bold>sparkling metodo classico</bold> wine from <bold>Trentino</bold>, made from <bold>100% Chardonnay</bold>. Fresh and refined, it offers <bold>aromas of golden apple, wildflowers, and yeast</bold>. On the palate, it is <bold>crisp, balanced, and elegant</bold> with a clean fruit-forward finish and fine mousse.
